you better believe I will be using it.  Of course, this means I have 
to go back and change one of the scenarios to use those.  If anyone 
wants a sample of my 1st few (I have already sent the 1st four to 
Tevildo) to check for difficulty, let me know and I will upload them 
to my website and post the link.  BTW, Tevildo could you send to me 
your generic PIX file?

--- In gladiator@egroups.com, "-Tevildo." <Tevildo@h...> wrote:
> Okay, if you're ready to take the extra step and add Editor.exe
into 
your 
> level-making process, here's what I've learned...
> 
> tiles 0-133 can be used; other numbers are available in Editor but 
if you 
> use these it will crash Scen.exe or Glad.exe
> 
> tile 8 is the one I mentioned previously, the "permeable wall"
which 
runs 
> vertical rather than horizontal (Use 'em, DPH!)
> 
> tiles 53 and 54 were apparently made funny, so I altered them into 
usable 
> column tiles--the Tevildo-altered versions are packed into
TevFifty, 
if you 
> want to use them
> 
> Editor.exe can also be used to change the dimensions of a map,
which 
I found 
> VERY useful, as some of my levels are very long one way and very 
thin the 
> other way. You can also use it to change all tiles of a particular 
type into 
> another type instantly. I suggest that everyone make a palette .PIX 
file 
> with samples of all 134 usable tiles, which you can pull up in 
Scen.exe for 
> easy access to any map pieces you could ever need. I'd simply send 
you mine, 
> but the Mailing List rules say no attachments. Anyway, I hope 
everyone can 
> use Editor successfully, as it's a powerful tool. I may use it to 
alter the 
> character images one of these days, but I have other projects to 
work on 
> first. Best of luck,
>          -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
>                  (http://hotyellow98.com/tevildo/glad.html)
>
